definition: to fuse together (idiom)/hypostatic union (religion)
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
old variant of 融[rong2]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)

sentences.english: The lover and the loved all melt into one.
sentences.chinese: 爱人者和被爱者是融为一体的。

sentences.english: Her letters conflate past and present.
sentences.chinese: 在她的信中过去和现在融为一体。

sentences.english: They form a kind of spiritual bond with their lover in union.
sentences.chinese: 他们会和爱人在灵魂上融为一体。

sentences.english: In this work, the writer successfully fuses past and present.
sentences.chinese: 在这部作品中，作者成动地把过去和现在融为一体。

sentences.english: International sport dance is a kind of activity blending sport with art.
sentences.chinese: 国际体育舞蹈是将体育与艺术融为一体的一项运动。

sentences.english: How does this parable fit into what comes before it and what comes after it?
sentences.chinese: 这个比喻与前后文是如何融为一体的？

sentences.english: Your memory and the vast information bank of the internet will be one at all times.
sentences.chinese: 你的记忆和互联网海量的信息库将随时融为一体。

sentences.english: The chameleon survives by blending in with its background.
sentences.chinese: 变色蜥蜴因能与环境融为一体而生存下来。

sentences.english: The play was so gripping that the audience quickly-fied with the actors.
sentences.chinese: 那出戏如此扣人心弦，以致观众很快和演员融为一体。

sentences.english: Her sweet voice chimed in beautifully with the echo of the music.
sentences.chinese: 她的甜润的嗓音与乐曲的回声美妙地融为一体。

sentences.english: At the zero-rate boundary, fiscal and monetary policies become one.
sentences.chinese: 在零利率分界线上，财政和货币政策会融为一体。

sentences.english: The play was so gripping that the audience quickly identified with the actors.
sentences.chinese: 那出戏如此扣人心弦，以致观众很快和演员融为一体。

sentences.english: The audience quickly identified with the characters of the play.
sentences.chinese: 观众很快地兴剧中人物融为一体。

sentences.english: On the right is a piece of sea, and meets the sky, blend into one.
sentences.chinese: 右边是一整片海，与天相接，交融为一体。

sentences.english: When two people become one, love is just setting sails for its long long journey.
sentences.chinese: 两个人融为一体的那一瞬，爱才刚刚扬帆准备远航。

definition: to blend into one another/to blend together well
a mixture/an amalgam/fusion/welding together/to be in harmony with (nature)/to harmonize with/to fit in
an integral whole/all concerned/everybody
to bring out the best in each other (idiom)/to complement one another well
to blend/to mix
to blend into/to integrate/to assimilate/to merge
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
to conform (with)/to echo/to correlate well/(linguistics) agreement
to complement one another (idiom)
to set each other off nicely
to link/to join/link/connection
mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
to reflect/to shine
to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
fusion/to combine as one
to unite
